comments: LAR shows Batum (CHA) initiates brief foot-to-foot contact with VanVleet (TOR) as the pick is set, but it is marginal and does not affect his ability to defend.
VanVleet (TOR) cleanly dislodges Walker (CHA) of the ball before making incidental contact with his thigh.

[Observable in enhanced video] RLB shows Lamb (CHA) gathers the ball on two feet and then lifts his right foot off of the floor, establishing his left foot as his pivot. He then lifts and re-plants his pivot foot as he starts his dribble.
Siakam (TOR) makes marginal body contact with Kaminsky (CHA) during rebounding.

Kaminsky (CHA) moves into Lowry's (TOR) path and initiates contact to his side that affects his SQBR. The contact occurs before Lowry gathers the ball and the play is correctly deemed a personal foul.

LAR shows Bacon (CHA) extends his arm around Lowry's (TOR) upper half and briefly makes contact to his head/neck area as he attempts to get around the screen.   Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Bacon (CHA) and Leonard (TOR) engage and disengage without affecting the other's FOM.
LLS shows Bacon (CHA) makes some contact with Lowry's (TOR) front/right arm, but it is marginal and does not affect his ability to gather.
LLS shows Bacon (CHA) has his forearm rested on Lowry's (TOR) front at the start of his upward shooting motion, but quickly removes it without applying any force.
VanVleet (TOR) maintains legal guarding position and makes incidental contact with Bacon (CHA).  He then makes clean contact with the ball.

RLS shows Siakam (TOR) extends his hand and makes slight contact with the side of Bacon's (CHA) head/neck area during rebounding, but does not affect his ability to retrieve the ball. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Siakam (TOR) continues moving into Lamb's (CHA) path and delivers body contact that affects his ability to defend.
Kaminsky (CHA) moves his pivot foot at the start of the spin move.
Siakam (TOR) makes marginal body contact with Kaminsky (CHA) at the start of his dribble that does not affect his SQBR.
Siakam (TOR) hedges the pick and makes marginal contact with Lamb's (CHA) front that does not affect his SQBR.
RLB shows VanVleet (TOR) makes clean contact with the ball as Lamb (CHA) begins his upward shooting motion.

Lowry (TOR) makes brief contact with his forearm to Kaminsky's (CHA) face during rebounding, but does not affect his ability to retrieve the ball. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Correctly called 24 second violation.
[Observable in enhanced video] Leonard (TOR) slides his pivot foot at the start of his dribble.
Bridges (CHA) places his arm around VanVleet's (TOR) midsection and makes contact that is tactile in nature.
VanVleet (TOR) and Walker (CHA) engage and disengage off ball without affecting the other's FOM.
Siakam (TOR) makes marginal body contact with Walker (CHA) that does not affect his SQBR at the start of his drive.
Leonard (TOR) moves his pivot foot at the start of his spin move.
Bacon (CHA) makes marginal body contact with Leonard (TOR) that does not affect his SQBR at the start of his drive.
Bacon (CHA) makes marginal contact with Leonard (TOR) after his gather.
Leonard (TOR) slightly extends his forearm against Bridges' (CHA) front as they approach the screen, but contact is marginal and does not affect his ability to defend.
Batum (CHA) legally contests Leonard's (TOR) jump shot attempt.
Correctly called jump ball.

The officiating crew communicated with the Replay Center to determine when the ball went out of bounds following the jump ball. After review, it was determined that the ball went out of bounds after the game clock expired.
